image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US elections 2024: Beyoncé lights up Houston rally in support of Kamala Harris
Washington Post's decision to not endorse US presidential candidate sparks uproar
item.description: The Washington Post’s choice to stop endorsing candidates in the 2024 presidential election has drawn criticism and resignations. Jeff Bezos reportedly initiated the change, leading to accusations of prioritizing business interests. Former editor Marty Baron and subscribers voiced strong dissatisfaction, seeing it as a threat to democracy and journalistic integrity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa astronaut recently back from space station hospitalised, condition stable
item.description: A Nasa astronaut remains hospitalized in stable condition after the SpaceX Crew-8 mission's return from the ISS, where they spent 235 days in space. Following standard medical evaluations, three crew members were cleared and released, while one continues to undergo further medical checks as a precaution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump vs Kamala Harris: 6 interesting facts about US Elections 2024
item.description: The US political arena is abuzz as Donald Trump faces Kamala Harris in the 2024 Presidential elections. Joe Biden stepped down due to health concerns and endorsed Harris, potentially making her the first female President. Early voting is available in 47 states, with independent candidates also playing significant roles in this tight race.

item.title: Musk defends $1 million daily giveaway following warning over violation of federal election law
item.description: Elon Musk defended his super PAC's $1 million daily giveaway, aimed at promoting constitutional rights, amidst DOJ concerns it may violate laws against paying for voter registration. The initiative targets registered voters in seven battleground states, endorsing support for the First and Second Amendments.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delta Air Line sues CrowdStrike over 'catastrophic' software update that prompted mass flight cancellations
item.description: Delta is suing cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike after a July outage caused by a faulty software update led to massive flight cancellations and $500 million in losses. The lawsuit claims CrowdStrike's untested update disrupted 8.5 million PCs globally, severely impacting Delta's operations. CrowdStrike denies liability, citing Delta's outdated IT infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Green camo & combat boots on, Indonesia's new president trains his cabinet at military camp
Don't give Awami student wing publicity, Bangladesh media warned
Chittagong sees biggest rally in months by Hindus
Trump whines about Obama's Nobel win
Zelensky rejects UN chief's plan to visit Kyiv over Russia trip: Ukrainian official
Trump: Xi will bully Harris 'like a baby'
Israeli air strike kills journalists covering war in Lebanon as they slept
Zelensky says North Korean troops poised to join war
item.description: North Korean troops are set to be deployed by Russia in Ukraine this weekend, escalating the conflict and raising global tensions. Ukrainian intelligence reports about 12,000 North Korean soldiers, including officers and generals, being prepared for combat, with initial deployments likely in the Kursk region.

item.title: Army releases redacted police report on altercation during controversial Trump's Arlington cemetery visit
item.description: The US Army released a heavily redacted report on a Trump campaign staffer allegedly pushing a cemetery employee at Arlington National Cemetery. The incident involved filming restrictions during Trump's visit. The police report was made public following a lawsuit by American Oversight, despite ongoing investigations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrats burn through cash while outraising Republicans in final weeks of fight for the Senate
item.description: Democratic candidates significantly outspent their Republican rivals in the first half of October in key Senate races across states like Ohio, Montana, and Michigan. This financial advantage allowed Democrats to allocate substantial resources to defend multiple states, while Republicans relied heavily on outside groups for support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Leonardo DiCaprio endorses Kamala Harris: 'We need a bold step forward ...'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Disgusting': Trump campaign slams Hillary Clinton for 'reenacting Nazi rally' attack
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese hackers targeted Trump, JD Vance's phones: Report
item.description: "The type of information on phones used by a presidential candidate and his running mate could be a gold mine for an intelligence agency: Who they called and texted, how often they communicated with certain people, and how long they talked to those people could be highly valuable to an adversary like China. That sort of communications data could be even more useful if hackers could observe it in real time," the NYT report said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Whatever Barron recommended broke the internet, says Trump campaign adviser on podcast choice
item.description: ​“I got to tell you, hats off to the young man (Barron Trump). Every single recommendation he’s had has turned out to be absolute ratings gold that’s broke the internet," Jason Miller said as Trump is all set to appear with Joe Rogan's podcast to be recorded today. Rogan's podcast is one of the most popular in the US with 14 million followers on the streaming platform Spotify. This will be Donald Trump's first appearance on Joe Rogan's podcast.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
